About Me

Hello! My name is Aaron and I am a Junior in Dunster House concentrating in Economics with a secondary in Psychology. While most of my time in the day is spent thinking about equilibrium and supply + demand graphs, I've always had an interest in engineering and general tinkering.

In high school, I took a couple of engineering classes that taught about 3D printing, woodworking, metalworking, and other engineering technologies. Since then, I've continued those tinkering skills and interests through origami and various DIY fixes in my dorm. In my free time, I love to watch Allen Pan, Michael Reeves, William Osman, and TheBackyardScientist.

One of my high school projects, making a prosthetic hand with working joints in one print!

At Harvard, I sing with the Harvard Glee Club, serve as a Peer Advising Fellow, and give haircuts with my business Kang's Cuts.
